column1: Task
Accept payment from customers, and make change as necessary.
Accept payments, and make change or write charge slips as necessary.
Administer breathing and oxygen procedures such as intermittent positive pressure breathing treatments, ultrasonic nebulizer treatments and incentive spirometer treatments.
Administer drugs, orally or by injection, and perform intravenous procedures under a physician's direction.
Administer drugs, orally or by injection, or perform intravenous procedures under a physician's direction.
Administer first aid according to prescribed procedures, and notify emergency medical personnel when necessary.
Administer first aid such as bandaging, splinting, and administering oxygen.
Administer local anesthetic agents.
Administer medication, immunizations, and blood plasma to animals as prescribed by veterinarians.
Administer medication, immunizations, or blood plasma to animals as prescribed by veterinarians.
Administer prescribed medications or start intravenous fluids, and note times and amounts on patients' charts.
Administer prescribed medications to animals.
Administer radiopharmaceuticals or radiation to patients to detect or treat diseases, using radioisotope equipment, under direction of physician.
Apply fluoride and sealants to teeth.
Apply fluorides or other cavity preventing agents to arrest dental decay.
Apply heat or cold therapy to patients using materials, such as heat pads, hydrocollator packs, warm compresses, cold compresses, heat lamps, or vapor coolants.
Apply protective coating of fluoride to teeth.
Assign to workers duties such as trees to be cut, cutting sequences and specifications, and loading of trucks, railcars, or rafts.
Attach ""out of order"" signs to malfunctioning machines, and notify technicians when machines need to be repaired or removed.
Attach electrodes to the patients' chests, arms, and legs, connect electrodes to leads from the electrocardiogram (EKG) machine, and operate the EKG machine to obtain a reading.
Brew coffee and tea, and fill containers with requested beverages.
Chart conditions of decay and disease for diagnosis and treatment by dentist.
Check patients' pulse, temperature and respiration.
Clean calcareous deposits, accretions, and stains from teeth and beneath margins of gums, using dental instruments.
Clean customers' nails in soapy water, using swabs, files, and orange sticks.
Collect blood or tissue samples from patients, observing principles of asepsis to obtain blood sample.
Collect laboratory specimens such as blood, urine, and feces for testing.
Collect laboratory specimens, such as blood, urine, or feces for testing.
Collect laboratory specimens, such as blood, urine, or feces, for testing.
Collect samples such as blood, urine and sputum from patients, and perform routine laboratory tests on samples.
Compute bills, collect payments, and make change for guests.

Conduct electrocardiogram (EKG), phonocardiogram, echocardiogram, stress testing, or other cardiovascular tests to record patients' cardiac activity, using specialized electronic test equipment, recording devices, and laboratory instruments.

Conduct electrocardiogram, phonocardiogram, echocardiogram, stress testing, and other cardiovascular tests to record patients' cardiac activity, using specialized electronic test equipment, recording devices, and laboratory instruments.
Conduct tests, such as electrocardiograms (EKGs), stress testing, and lung capacity tests, to evaluate patients' cardiopulmonary functions.
Conduct tests, such as electrocardiograms, stress testing, and lung capacity tests, to evaluate patients' cardiopulmonary functions.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, and numbers of portions to be served.
Demonstrate respiratory care procedures to trainees and other health care personnel.
Demonstrate respiratory care procedures to trainees or other healthcare personnel.
Demonstrate use of laboratory equipment, and enforce laboratory rules.
Direct welders to build up low spots or short pieces with weld.
Exchange currency for customers, converting currency into requested combinations of bills and coins.
Fix minor problems, such as equipment jams, and notify repair personnel of major equipment problems.
Gather materials to be filed from departments and employees.
Gather materials to be filed from departments or employees.
Give enemas and perform catheterizations, ear flushes, intravenous feedings, and gavages.
Help physicians examine and treat patients, handing them instruments and materials or performing such tasks as giving injections and removing sutures.
Help physicians examine and treat patients, handing them instruments and materials or performing such tasks as giving injections or removing sutures.
Immobilize patient for placement on stretcher and ambulance transport, using backboard or other spinal immobilization device.
Immunize patients to protect them from preventable diseases.
Issue clothing, tools, and other authorized items to inmates.
Issue equipment, such as farm implements, machinery, ladders, or containers to workers, and collect equipment when work is complete.
Issue or distribute materials, products, parts, and supplies to customers or coworkers, based on information from incoming requisitions.
Itemize and total customer merchandise selection at checkout counter, using cash register, and accept cash or charge card for purchases.
Lay out materials such as puzzles, scissors and eating utensils for use in therapy, and clean and repair these tools after therapy sessions.
Lay out pipe routes, following written instructions or blueprints and coordinating layouts with supervisors.
Lay out pipe routes, following written instructions or blueprints, and coordinating layouts with supervisors.
Lend and collect books, periodicals, videotapes, and other materials at circulation desks.
Locate items requested by customers.
Measure and record patients' vital signs, such as height, weight, temperature, blood pressure, pulse and respiration.
Measure and take impressions of patients' jaws and teeth in order to determine the shape and size of dental prostheses, using face bows, dental articulators, recording devices, and other materials.
Measure patient's range-of-joint motion, body parts, and vital signs to determine effects of treatments or for patient evaluations.
Measure patients' range-of-joint motion, body parts, and vital signs to determine effects of treatments or for patient evaluations.
Monitor food preparation and serving techniques to ensure that proper procedures are followed.
Monitor food preparation or serving techniques to ensure that proper procedures are followed.
Operate cash register to process cash and credit sales.
Operate cash registers to accept payment from customers.
Operate cash registers to accept payments for food and beverages.
Operate cash registers to receive payments from patrons.
Operate communication systems, such as telephone, switchboard, intercom, two-way radio, or public address.
Operate specialized photographic equipment in order to obtain photographs for drivers' licenses and photo identification cards.
Order supplies and equipment, and issue them to personnel.
Participate in fire prevention and inspection programs.
Patrol an assigned area by vehicle or on foot to ensure public compliance with existing parking ordinance.
Perform dental work such as cleaning, polishing, and extracting teeth.
Perform health care related tasks, such as monitoring vital signs and medication, under the direction of registered nurses and physiotherapists.
Perform health-care related tasks, such as monitoring vital signs and medication, under the direction of registered nurses and physiotherapists.
Perform healthcare-related tasks, such as monitoring vital signs and medication, under the direction of registered nurses or physiotherapists.
Perform medical procedures such as administering oxygen, inserting and removing airways, taking vital signs, and giving emergency treatment such as first aid or cardiopulmonary resuscitation.
Perform medical procedures, such as administering oxygen, inserting and removing airways, taking vital signs, or giving emergency treatment, such as first aid or cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR).
Perform nursing duties such as administering medications, measuring vital signs, collecting specimens and drawing blood samples.
Perform other clerical duties such as answering telephone, sorting and distributing mail, running errands or sending faxes.

Perform procedures, such as linear tomography, mammography, sonograms, joint and cyst aspirations, routine contrast studies, routine fluoroscopy, or examinations of the head, trunk, or extremities under supervision of physician.
Perform simple vehicle maintenance procedures such as checking oil and gas, and report mechanical problems to supervisors.
Perform therapeutic procedures, such as injections, immunizations, suturing and wound care, and infection management.
Pick up and drop off students at regularly scheduled neighborhood locations, following strict time schedules.
Prepare a major meal, following recipes and determining group food quantities.
Prepare a variety of foods according to customers' orders or supervisors' instructions, following approved procedures.
Prepare and administer medications as directed by a physician.
Prepare and administer medications, vaccines, serums, and treatments, as prescribed by veterinarians.
Prepare and serve beverages such as coffee and fountain drinks.
Prepare bills for food, using cash registers, calculators, or adding machines; and accept payment and make change.
Prepare customers' nails in soapy water, using swabs, files, and orange sticks.
Prepare dressings or bandages and apply or assist with their application following surgery.
Prepare patient, sterilize and disinfect instruments, set up instrument trays, prepare materials, and assist dentist during dental procedures.
Prepare simple foods and beverages such as sandwiches, salads, and coffee.
Prepare surgical equipment and pass instruments or materials to veterinarians during surgical procedures.
Prepare surgical equipment, and pass instruments and materials to veterinarians during surgical procedures.
Procure beverages, food, and other items as requested.

Provide basic patient care and treatments, such as taking temperatures and blood pressure, dressing wounds, treating bedsores, giving enemas, douches, alcohol rubs, and massages, or performing catheterizations.

Provide basic patient care and treatments, such as taking temperatures or blood pressures, dressing wounds, treating bedsores, giving enemas or douches, rubbing with alcohol, massaging, or performing catheterizations.
Provide respiratory care involving the application of well-defined therapeutic techniques under the supervision of a respiratory therapist and a physician.
Receive checks and cash for deposit, verify amounts, and check accuracy of deposit slips.
Record and maintain records of patient condition and activity, including vital signs, eating habits, and behavior.
Record services provided on cashiers' tickets or receive payment from customers.
Request and record customer orders, and compute bills using cash registers, multicounting machines, or pencil and paper.
Run cash registers.
Scrub arms and hands and assist the surgical team to scrub and put on gloves, masks, and surgical clothing.
Serve meals, distribute commissary items, and dispense prescribed medication to prisoners.
Serve salads, vegetables, meat, breads, and cocktails; ladle soups and sauces; portion desserts; and fill beverage cups and glasses.
Signal crane operator to lower basic assembly units to bedplate, and align unit to centerline.
Take and prepare to-go orders.
Take and record measures of patients' physical condition, using devices such as thermometers and blood pressure gauges.
Take and record medical and dental histories and vital signs of patients.
Take customers' orders and write ordered items on tickets, giving ticket stubs to customers when needed to identify filled orders.
Train workers in food preparation, and in service, sanitation, and safety procedures.
Use ventilators and various oxygen devices and aerosol and breathing treatments in the provision of respiratory therapy.
